availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison W. Waggener (Morganfield, Kentucky, saddler and county clerk)

body.p: Morganfield, Kentucky, saddler and county clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Parmelia Waggener. Father of S. E. R. Waggener, Emma Waggener, John M. Waggener, Ann E. Waggener, L. C. Waggener, Joshua B. Waggener, Harry W. Waggener, and Sallie Waggener. Saddler in Morganfield in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860. Clerk of the Union County Court in the 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Union, Morganfield, p. 206; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Union County, Morganfield, p. 33;Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Union County, Morganfield, p. 1; KYR-0001-007-0366.
